name: Camouflage Similarity
description: A protective protocol where individuals or cultures adopt the surface appearance of imposed similarity in order to survive. Unlike Masked Similarity (false kinship imposed by domination), Camouflage Similarity is chosen by the vulnerable as a survival strategy, allowing hidden memory and resonance to be preserved.
characteristics: Outward compliance to hostile norms for protection
Inner continuity of memory, stories, and resonance
Transmission of knowledge through hidden codes, symbols, and rituals
Camouflage dissolves when conditions are safe for re-emergence
risks: Generational forgetting of the inner vs. outer distinction
Loss of memory if elders are silenced or removed
strengths: Holds threads of kinship quietly until they can be revealed
Embeds resilience through hidden layers of language and symbol
